um we have to calculate the tensor product between the two vectors and in linear algebra a tensor product between

performing Quantum simulations on the classical devices and classical computers is pretty much impossible

the the the size of the Matrix of representing the logic gate in this case
corresponds to the amount of qubits that it acts upon so the age gate acts on the
single qubit only because the single qubit state is two-dimensional The Matrix has to be two by two as well now
the C naught acts on two qubits a state of two qubits because of the tensor product is four dimensional and
therefore the Matrix has to be four-dimensional as well and what this gate does it treats the
first qubit as a control and the second qubit is a Target and it will flip or apply the not logic to the
Target if the control is in a state cat 1. so in other words we can we can we can draft a a sort of a truth table
so this is our first qubit the second qubit right control Target and in the first two cases because the control is
in a state cat 0 well effectively nothing happens when we apply C naught that is really no change to our qubits
but in the second of the of the or the bottom two cases because the control is in a state Cat 1
the target gets flipped so it gets flipped from uh cat 0 to cat one and from cat one to get zero
now you might you might actually object at this stage and say well there's nothing Quantum about this right because
we can we can plug in Here regular beats or or booleans and it would work the
exact same way and that is true however we can also ask an interesting question namely what happens when the control is
in a superposition now we already said that when the qubit is in a superposition we can consider it
to be in both States cat 0 and Cat 1 at the same time but if in the C note gate it is supposed
to flip the target if it is in a state Cat 1 then
when it is in a superposition of both cat0 and Cat one would it Flip or would it not flip the Target and the answer is

cat zero apply H to the first one this creates a superposition over the control and now we apply C naught to both of
them and once we go through the the calculation this is what we end up with and this looks very much like a
superposition state that we that we saw before except it now spans across two
qubits in a way I mean superposition is sort of contagious it has spilled from one qubit into the other qubit now
and what this tells us is that when these qubits are observed they would both collapse to get zero or
both would collapse to get one because they are entangled right so for the time being they both of them are both cad0
rank at one simultaneously but when they get observed they would both collapse to get zero and both collapse took at one
with 50 probability there is never going to be an outcome where one collapses two cat one and one collapses to get zero
this is entanglement now it doesn't seem like much but it completely destroys our understanding of reality
because here's the thing quantum mechanics also tells us that an entangled State cannot be decomposed into a tensor product of the individual
Quantum State now this is a fancy way of saying that from the perspective of quantum mechanics the smallest possible
unit of reality now is this entangled pair of qubits or particles or whatever
you entangle they do not exist as independent entities anymore there is no
mathematical description in quantum mechanics to actually separate them anymore they have to be considered as one
but the problem is we can send one of them over there and we can send the other over there in principle they could
be at the opposite ends of the universe and still quantum mechanics will tell us that they form one thing and we have to
consider them together now this is quite interesting because
they are both of them are actually in a superposition so when we measure them one of them it would collapse randomly
to cat0 and get one when the second one is measured they would sort of synchronize themselves to make sure that
they produce the exact same value now Chinese researchers they have a Quantum
satellite in the low orbit and they can actually create entanglement in the satellite and they can beam one of the
particles in the entangled pair to a ground station in China and the other to a ground station in Europe now what you
can do for example is you can time the measurement of those particles to the fraction of a second to ensure that no
influence can propagate between them not even light has enough time to travel between them and yet they would always
produce the exact same value now Einstein hated it right he called it spooky action at the distance
and he spent a lot of time trying to prove that this is incorrect and he had this
idea that you know what there is no Randomness here at all it is all predetermined like he basically said
when they get entangled they agree on what they would collapse to let's say let's agree to collapse to get zero then
they go their separate ways and then they collapse to get zero then there is no mysterious influence or synchronization happening but he
actually never found a mathematical solution for this and the reason is because he was wrong in 1964 at CERN in
Geneva John Bell came up with a brilliant mathematical proof that showed that the correlations exhibited by
Quantum objects entangled Quantum objects are stronger than anything that you can pre-encode into them and we call
this non-locality and locality means that effectively in physics locality means that no influence can propagate
faster than the speed of light and last year's Nobel Prize in physics Was Won by another aspect John clauser
and Anton seilinger who over the 1970s 80s and 90s developed a series of experiments that basically showed that
entanglement is really there and that John Bell was right and Einstein was wrong now we don't really know what
